Outstanding achievement! Clark Honors College undergraduate Emily Niebergall has been awarded a prestigious Barry Goldwater Scholarship!

Emily, who is conducting her honors thesis research in our laboratory under the mentorship of Dr. Emily Beck, is one of only a select number of students chosen from thousands of nominees nationwide. This exceptional honor recognizes Emily as one of the country's most promising future scientists.

## About the Goldwater Scholarship

The Barry Goldwater Scholarship is:

- The most prestigious undergraduate award in STEM fields
- Awarded to only ~400 students nationally from thousands of nominees
- Recognition of exceptional research potential
- A pathway to top graduate programs
- Validation of scientific excellence

## Emily's Research Excellence

Emily's award-winning research focuses on:

- Onset of adaptive immunity in threespine stickleback
- Host-microbiome interactions during development
- Impact of microbes on immune system maturation
- Advancing stickleback as an immunogenetics model
- Integration of genomics and immunology

## Research Innovation

Emily's work is pioneering because it:

- Pinpoints developmental timing of immune responses
- Connects microbiome to immune development
- Uses cutting-edge molecular techniques
- Addresses fundamental biological questions
- Has implications for human health

## Mentorship Excellence

Working with Dr. Emily Beck, Emily Niebergall has:

- Designed independent research projects
- Mastered complex laboratory techniques
- Presented at scientific conferences
- Co-authored scientific manuscripts
- Demonstrated exceptional scientific thinking
